title: Using the Quotient Rule for Logarithms
text: Using the quotient rule, $$\ln(\frac{x^4 y}{7})=\ln(x^4 y)-\ln(7)$$
speech: Using the quotient rule,  the natural log of, parentheses fraction, x to the fourth y, over 7,   is equal to the natural log of, parentheses, x to the fourth y,  minus the natural log of, 7
pacedSpeech: Using the quotient rule,  this expression

title: Using the Product Rule for Logarithms
speech: Using the product rule,  the natural log of, parentheses, x to the fourth y,  minus the natural log of, 7 is equal to the natural log of, parentheses x to the fourth  plus the natural log of, y, minus the natural log of, 7
pacedSpeech: Using the product rule,  this expression

title: Using the Power Rule
speech: Using the power rule,  the natural log of, parentheses x to the fourth  plus the natural log of, y, minus the natural log of, 7 is equal to 4 the natural log of, x, plus the natural log of, y, minus the natural log of, 7
pacedSpeech: Using the power rule,  this expression
